## This room will be closed and archived.
** @/all Please move discussion of this topic to our forum, or to one of the official Free Code Camp chat rooms: http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/free-code-camp-official-chat-rooms/19390**

-----

-----

@aayanqazi It's advised to use the Facebook group

That’s a good point, @abdulhannanali. Fortunately, many people are able to access it with VPNs. But you are correct, some people will be excluded. That’s unfortunate, but Chinese and Iranians are only a very small percentage of our campers, anyway. For almost everyone else, it’s more convenient to use Facebook groups.
@QuincyLarson just one problem is that Facebook is not available in big countries like China and Iran. Other than that it's the best thing for community out there.
@QuincyLarson Really smart choice..  Google have tried to revamp the Google Plus too and giving it a total redesign but all efforts are going in vain.
Google will probably shut down Google Plus in a year or two anyway - it isn’t heavily used.

Almost everyone already has a Facebook account, and is frequently going there anyway, so it’s more convenient to just use a Facebook group. Also, Facebook groups are much more evolved that Google+ in my humble opinion. They have good event capabilities.
@QuincyLarson What's the reason of choosing Fb Groups in comparison to something like Google+  Communities and Groups?

##Please note that we now recommend campers use their Campsite’s Facebook group for chatting instead of their campsite’s Gitter chatroom. 
We are doing this because few of our Campsite Gitter chatroooms have active synchronous discussions, and about 1/3rd of conversations consist of someone saying “hello” and not getting a response. Most of the discussions are asynchronous, which Facebook posts and group messages are better suited for.
We’ve removed this Gitter room from our Campsite directory. Still, we will keep it open for archival purposes, and you can keep using it if you’d like.
Here’s a short blog post about how our Campsites are evolving and growing: http://blog.freecodecamp.com/2015/09/jump-start-your-local-campsite-with-coffee-and-code.html
